title: Set up embedded Event Browser
content:
This document describes how to set up the integration that enables OpenText Service Management (Service Management, formerly known as SMAX) users to directly view OBM event data in the Service Management UI.

This integration doesn't involve syncing event data between Service Management and OBM. The use case for forwarding OBM events to create incidents in Service Management is documented in Integrate with OBM for incident and event data synchronization.

Overview

Use case

Incident analysts often struggle to find meaningful information to analyze incidents raised by end users. To help incident analysts find relevant information to troubleshoot incidents faster, we embedded the Configuration Item (CI) Topology and OBM Event Browser into the Service Management incident form.
With real-time access to OBM event data, incident analysts can immediately see events for the service that the incident is created for. With this information, the analyst can identify potential root causes of an incident much quicker, and can also collaborate with other teams more easily since real-time event data can be seen by all team members working on the incident. This will allow the users to work on the same fundamental data in ESM when doing Incident Management or in Service Assurance when doing Event Management and enables the systems to show details about the status of Services and CIs.

To enable the cross-functional ITOM use cases, CIs and Services have to be in sync between ESM and Service Assurance. IdM configurations are required to enable Single-Sign-On (SSO) between Service Management and OBM.

Architecture

Component Explanation
Service Management / UCMDBInstance Native SACM deployment
OBM Instance OBM deployment with the attached RTSM
IdM XYZ suite IdM for a tenant
IdM ABC OBM IdM
IDP  Identity Provider
Data Flow Probe Required to push data from UCMDB to RTSM

To enable the embedded Event Browser, you need to configure the following components. See details in the following sections.

  • IdM enables Single Sign On between Service Management and OBM.

    The first option is to use the same Identity Provider (IDP)*

    The second option is to set up OIDC link between Service Management and OBM IdM*
     
  • UCMDB and RTSM synchronizes CIs and Services between UCMDB and OBM RTSM. This is required to have the same foundational data for event filtering.
  • Service Management: to activate the widget.

Connectivity

Source Target Protocol/Port Usage
UCMDB RTSM HTTPS / 443 Push CIs to RTSM using the data flow probe.
Service Management IdM OBM IdM HTTPS / 443 Single-Sign-On between Service Management  and OBM
Service Management UI Event Browser HTTPS / 443 Load Event Browser into the Service Management UI

Prerequisites

To use the embedded Event Browser, you must meet the following prerequisites for the systems and supported versions:

  • SaaS

    • Service Management 23.4 or higher version

    • Native SACM / UCMDB 23.4 or higher version, with content pack deployed

    • OBM containerized 23.4 or higher version

    • Data Flow Probe (optional)

  • On-premises

    • Service Management 23.4 or higher version

    • Native SACM / UCMDB 23.4 or higher version, with content pack deployed

    • OBM classic 23.4 or higher version, with IdM activated

    • Data Flow Probe (optional)

  • CI synchronization is setup between UCMDB and RTSM. See here for details.

Service Management and OBM can both run in SaaS or on-premises. We also support a hybrid mode, where Service Management runs in SaaS and OBM runs on-premises.

Configure OBM

Create integration user

Create a new user in IdM and assign the proper UCMDB role to allow synchronizing data.

Load management pack

The OBM management pack includes configuration files that are required by the embedded Event Browser. The management pack includes:

  • A view for RTSM called Services_Cis
  • A read-only role for Service Management users

To load the management pack, download the file SMAX_Integration_23_4.zip from the Marketplace and copy it to the OBM Server. 
Windows

  • Copy the file to: <Installation Path>\BSM\opr\mgmtpacks
  • Run the script: <Installation Path>\BSM\bin\opr-mp-installer.bat -install SMAX_Integration

Linux

  • Copy the file to: /opt/HP/BSM/opr/mgmtpacks
  • Run the script: /opt/HP/BSM/bin/opr-mp-installer.sh -install SMAX_Integration
In SaaS, contact the SaaS Ops team to load the management pack.

Change Infrastructure Settings

  1. Navigate to the OBM Infrastructure Settings Management.
  2. Search for CSP and change the setting Content Security Policy (CSP) trusted sources. Add the fully qualified domain name of OpenText Service Management as a trusted domain. If it has a custom domain configured, add that as well.
  3. Change the User login disallowed characters setting to allow special characters used in external IDP. For example, remove @ when your login name is the email.

    Configure SSO between Service Management and OBM

    In SaaS, contact the SaaS Ops team to complete the IdM configuration in Service Management and OBM.

    To enable Service Management users to access the OBM Event Browser without the need to log in to OBM each time, you need to set up SSO between the two systems. You have two options:

    Option 1 – Shared IDP using SAML Single Sign On (SSO)

    • Configure SAML SSO for Service Management
    • Configure SAML SSO for OBM
    • Users are automatically assigned to the correct group in the OBM IdM

    Option 2 – Single Sign On (SSO) using the IdM OIDC client

    • Configure an OIDC client in suite IdM so that the OBM IdM can trust the suite IdM
    • New users are created at the first login in the OBM IdM
    • Users are automatically assigned to the correct group in the OBM IdM

    Shared IDP using SAML Single Sign On (SSO)

    1. Configure the SAML SSO for Service Management. 
      Follow this doc to set up SAML authentication in Service Management.

    2. Configure the SAML SSO for OBM.
      Follow the OBM documentation to set up SAML authentication in OBM.

    Single Sign On (SSO) using the IdM OIDC client

    Configure suite IdM

    Go to the suite IdM of your tenant, and then configure an OIDC client so that OBM IdM can trust the suite IdM.

    Field Value

    Name

    The name of the OIDC client
    Display Name The display name of the OIDC client

    Client Id

    Client Id

    Note: This value is required later in the OBM IdM setup.
    Client Secret

    Client secret

    Note: This value is required later in the OBM IdM setup.
    Redirect URL  https://<OBM fully qualified domain name>/idm-service/idm/v0/oauth2
    Authorized Grant Types authorization_code

    Configure OBM IdM for SSO

    For the hybrid setup, where Service Management runs in SaaS and OBM on-premises, typically you need to set a proxy to allow the OBM IdM to connect to the suite IdM. When using the OIDC option, the OBM IdM will connect to the suite IdM to get the required data to create the user in the OBM IdM. To configure the proxy, perform the following steps:

    Classic OBM

    Windows

    Set the following environment variables:

    • HTTPS_PROXY="<your https proxy like https://proxy:8080>"
    • HTTP_PROXY="<your http proxy like http://proxy:8080>"
    • NO_PROXY="<your non proxy settings like *.internalDomain.com>"

    Linux

    Set the following environment variables:

    • HTTPS_PROXY="<your https proxy like https://proxy:8080>"
    • HTTP_PROXY="<your http proxy like http://proxy:8080>"
    • NO_PROXY="<your non proxy settings like *.internalDomain.com>"

    Containerized OBM

    Update the values.yaml file and the HTTP_PROXY, HTTPS_PROXY and NO_PROXY parameters for IdM.

    Go to the OBM IdM of your instance, click the Authentication tab, and add a new configuration of type OAUTH and a new configuration group. Example:

    Complete the following fields on the OAuth Setting page.

    Field Value
    Client Id The Client Id from the suite IdM
    Client Secret The Client secret from the suite IdM
    Authorization Mode authorization_code
    IDP URL https://<Service Management fully qualified domain name>/idm-service/oidc
    Certificate

    Add the certificate from the Service Management Server. The certificate must represent the full certificate chain.
    Username Attribute name

    Make sure the configuration group default is set as Web Default and API Default, and the new authentication group isn't set as the default group for Web or API access.

    Configure automatic user permission assignment

    Configure the following in the OBM IdM to automatically assign Service Management users to a group, and the users can inherit the SMAX Readonly Roles (for OBM and for UCMDB) from the group. The procedure applies to both SSO options mentioned above.

    1. Select the Groups tab.

    2. Click Add to add a new group, for example,  SMAX Users.

    3. In the Associated Roles field, select the SMAX Readonly Role that the users in this group should have. The role SMAX Readonly Role is imported with the OBM management pack that is loaded in the CI synchronization configuration process.

    4. Click Save to save the group.

    5. In the Associated Group Rule section, click Add to add a group rule that automatically adds users to this group according to the users' authentication source. Complete the following fields.

    Field Value
    Rule Type Calculated
    Combination Strategy  AND
    Display Label Assign users to SMAX group
    Criteria

    Enter the following criteria key and value according to which SSO option you chose.

    For option 1 - the shared IDP option:

    • Key: http://schemas.microsoft.com/identity/claims/tenantid

    • Value: The tenant Id from Azure

    • Match: MATCH

    For option 2 - the OIDC Client option:

    • Key: client_id

    • Value: The client Id from suite IdM

    • Match: MATCH

    To verify that this configuration is successful, access this URL: https://<OBM fqdn>:<port>?auth=<config group>, where <config group> is the name of the configured configuration group. Your configuration is successful if you see the following behaviors:

    • The system displays the Service Management login page.
    • The user can log in with Service Management credentials.
    • In OBM IdM, the user is added to the configured group, which has the SMAX ReadOnly role.

    Enable widget display

    You can use the procedures below to enable the widget display.

    • Configure infratstructure settings in OBM
    • Enable the widget display in Service Management

    Configure Infrastructure Settings in OBM

    Go to Infrastructure Settings Management, search for CSP, and enter the Service Management fully qualified domain name as the trusted domain.

    Enable the widget display in Service Management

    Complete the following configurations in Service Management.

    Enable the Event Browser widget

    Do the following to enable the OBM Event Browser widget for the Incident record type:

    1. Log in to the agent interface as the tenant admin.

    2. Go to  Administration > Utilities > Integration > Integration Configuration.
    3. Select Operations Bridge Manager in th e left pane.
    4. In the Widget URL field, replace the placeholder text for the OBM hostname and tenant name with the actual value.

      If you use 24.2 or earlier version of OBM, change /opr-web/eventBrowser/app to /opr-console/opr-evt-browser.
      If you use Classic OBM, remove &tenant=<tenant name> from the URL.
    5. Select the Active check box to enable the configuration.
    6. Click Save.
    7. Click Add. The system displays the Add configuration for record type dialog.
    8. Select the Incident record type. The system displays the OBM configuration page for the incident record type.
    9. Select the Active check box to enable the configuration for the incident record type.

    Add OBM hostname to the Authorized domains list

    Configure Authorized domains for OBM servers so that the widget can be displayed in Service Management.

    1. Log in to the agent interface as the tenant admin.

    2. Go to Administration > Application settings.
    3. Add the hostname for the OBM system to the Authorized domains for navigation field.
    4. Click Save.

    Configure settings to allow widget display

    To display the OBM Event Browser widget in Service Management, you must configure content security policies as below.

    1. Log in to the agent interface as the tenant admin.
    2. Navigate to Administration > Configuration > Application Settings.
    3. Click Configure next to the Content security policy option.
    4. Click Add item, and then select Frame-src.
    5. Add *<OBM server FQDN> in the Frame-src field.
    6. Click Add item, and then select Frame-ancestors.
    7. Add *<OBM server FQDN> in the Frame-ancestors field.
    8. Click OK.
    9. Click Save.
